## Iris `r {params$Species}`

***Iris `r {params$Species}`***

![Iris `r {params$Species}`](`r {params$image_paths}`)  
`r {params$descriptions}`

Here is a very basic plot showing the relationship of petal length to petal width. Not surprisingly, as the length increases, so too does the width.

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| warning: false

data <- iris

ggplot(iris %>% 
         filter(Species == params$Species), aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) +
  xlab("Petal Length") +
  ylab("Petal Width") +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method='lm') +
  labs(title = stringr::str_glue("Petal Width vs Petal Length in Iris {params$Species}"))

```
